intro: Minasia splettiae, commonly known as the rock parsley, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of southern Europe. It belongs to the Apiaceae family, which includes carrots and celery, and is characterized by its finely divided leaves and small white or yellowish flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or gravelly soils and thrives in sunny, well-drained environments. It is often found in alpine and subalpine habitats, where it plays a role in stabilizing soil and supporting local biodiversity. Due to its specific habitat requirements, it is considered a rare and sensitive species in many areas.
